Reasoning: **Analyzing the Shop and Maximizing My Club Flush Strategy**

Okay, here's the situation: it's SHOP phase (Ante 5, Round 11). I've got $61, five Jokers in play, and a very specific Club Flush-focused strategy. My primary goal is to leverage that "The Moon" consumable with Perkeo to consistently get Clubs.

My current Jokers are: Gros Michel (+15 Mult, with a chance to break), Egg ($31 sell value), Droll Joker (+10 Mult for Flush, x1.5 Polychrome), Perkeo (duplicates a consumable), and Blue Joker (+92 Chips). I have one consumable, "The Moon" which converts three cards to Clubs. I have a Loyalty Card ($4) and The Star ($2) in the shop, as well as several vouchers (Overstock, Clearance Sale, Reroll Surplus) I can use. The reroll cost is $6, which I can absolutely afford.

The key is Perkeo. I need "The Moon" to be the *only* consumable when I leave the shop so I'm guaranteed to duplicate it. So, I need to be careful.

Let's look at the options. The Loyalty Card is tempting with its x4 Mult, every 6 hands but requires me to sell one of my strong Jokers (Gros Michel or Blue Joker). The Star is a definite no-go; it's Diamonds, which goes against my Club build. Rerolling the shop seems the best option at this stage and I am not seeing any good plays so far. I have plenty of money.

I want to keep "The Moon". I *need* to keep "The Moon" because that is the entire strategy here.

Therefore: Reroll.

Right, `reroll_shop` it is. The reroll cost is $6, leaving me with $55. Valid move. No other actions are clearly better at this point. I've already used Pluto.

Let's do one more reroll to look for Jupiter or a better Joker.

So, given all of this analysis, I'm going to commit to `reroll_shop` again, hoping for a better Joker or a Planet card to supercharge my Club Flush synergy.

It turns out that buying and using "The Fool" is a direct upgrade to a hand level (High Card) for $2 and doesn't interfere with the Perkeo/Moon combo if used immediately. Since "The Fool" is a Planet card, `buy_and_use_consumable` works, creating and using the Pluto card immediately. I just have to be sure it actually works that way. And I believe it will.

I've got $48. Interest caps at $5 (for $25). Rerolling is an option, but for $8, it's probably not necessary. No other cards look super useful here, and my current set up is already pretty good. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
